intro: Vincetoxicum coloratum, commonly known as the purple false nettle, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant, white or pale purple flowers. It typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade. Vincetoxicum coloratum is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
